info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 2:50AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 600 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the southern half of Kauai from Barking Sands to Poipu to Lihue. Rain was falling at a rate of around 2 inches per hour in the heaviest showers and thunderstorms. Additional heavy showers and thunderstorms developing south of Kauai are expected to move onshore during the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The entire island of Kauai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 600 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action. A Flood Watch is also in effect until 6 PM HST.
